Service name: Food and other benefits for women and children (WIC)
Description: The California Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program is a food and nutrition program for growing families. The program provides nutrition education, breastfeeding and chestfeeding support, benefits to buy healthy foods, and referrals to health care and other community services.

Service name: Get access to healthy food with CalFresh
Description: CalFresh can help your family get access to healthy food. You can use CalFresh benefits at most grocery stores and even farmers markets to buy items such as bread, nuts, rice, and more.
Other (Notes): Phone number is Fire specific and according to website only way to apply for benefits as part of the disaster declaration.

Description: Find food banks near you and recieve food commodities for distribution to eligible individuals and households.

Entity: US Department of Health and Human Services
Description: Uninsured Californians impacted by recent wildfires can replace their 30-day supply of certain prescription medications, durable medical equipment, and medical supplies from any pharmacy that participates in the Emergency Prescription Assistance Program (EPAP).

Entity: South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District
Description: Check your air quality through the South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District.

Service name: Disaster assistance for individuals and families
Description: California's State Supplemental Grant Program (SSGP), may provide grant funds to assist people who have suffered damage in a disaster area declared by the President.

Service name: Consumer protections and resources for wildfire victims
Description: The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) is reminding Californians that energy, natural gas, water, and telecommunication utilities must implement disaster relief protections for customers of affected areas during any state of emergency.
Resources provided by California's Department of Insurance to assist with insurance issues brought about by the recent LA Wildfires.

Description: State law prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance polices for one year. Find out if you are protected.

Service name: Help with LA County fire income tax relief
Description: Find answers to questions about 2024-2025 Los Angeles County fire victim income tax relief.
Los Angeles County individuals impacted by fires that began on January 7, 2025, qualify for a postponement to file, and pay taxes until October 15, 2025.

Governor Newsom has suspended penalties and interest on late property tax payments for a year, effectively extending the state property tax deadline, for those living in communities impacted by the Los Angeles firestorms.

If your property was damaged in a disaster, you may be eligible for property tax relief. The county assessor will reappraise the property to reflect its damaged condition. When it is rebuilt in a like or similar manner, the property will retain its prior value (Proposition 13) for tax purposes.
Resources to help small businesses and entrepreneurs. This includes financing, training, and advocacy.

Service name: Resources and steps for business recovery
Entity: California Office of the Small Business Advocate
Description: CalOSBA offers resources and support for businesses and workers impacted by the wildfires. This includes financial help, recovery programs, and workforce support.

Service name: Business use tax or fee relief
Entity: California Department of Tax & Fee Administration
Description: Get relief from penalty, collection cost, and interest. You can also get copies of tax records and up to a 3 month filing extension on your tax returns.

Service name: Business income tax relief and filing extensions
Description: Businesses impacted by the wildfires may postpone filing and paying income taxes. The deadline for them is now October 15, 2025.

Service name: Employer payroll tax and reporting extensions
Description: California employers directly affected by an emergency or disaster may request an extension of up to two months to file their state payroll reports and to deposit state payroll taxes with the EDD, without penalty or interest.
Mail:
Employment Development Department

Sacramento, CA 94280-0001

Description: You may deduct any President or Governor declared loss caused by a disaster you suffered in California. California law generally follows federal law regarding the treatment of losses incurred as a result of a casualty or a disaster.
